snippet: Wreckage from the tsunami off the coast of Japan last year is slowly making its way to American shores, and beachcombers say the debris has begun to reach land.
abstract: Wreckage from the tsunami that struck the coast of Japan in March 2011 is slowly making its way to America's western shores, and beachcombers say the debris has begun to reach land.
lead_paragraph: Wreckage from the tsunami off the coast of Japan last year is slowly making its way to American shores, and beachcombers say the debris has begun to reach land.

headline.seo: Looking for Tsunami Debris on West Coast Beaches
headline.main: On West Coast, Looking for Flotsam of a Disaster
headline.print_headline: Looking for Flotsam of a Disaster
